task.title: Add a Managed Object(s) to a Collection from Search Results

ul.li: You have a Managed Object to add.

There is limit imposed on the maximum number of objects that can be added to a Collection. If the number of selected objects being added to a new or existing Collection exceeds this limit an error dialog is displayed. The default limit is 25,000 objects. Note: If you require a change to the collection size limit, contact your system administrator.

You have appropriate access rights to modify a Collection. You can modify your public or private Collections. An Administrator can modify other user's public Collections. See Prerequisites for user role details.

context.p: This tutorial describes how to add Managed Object(s) (MO) to a new or existing Collection from search results.

li.xref: Select MO(s) from the Results Table
Add the MO(s) to a Collection

step.cmd: Select MO(s) from the Results Table

ol.li: In the Network Explorer Results Table, click the row to make a single selection. Multiple selections can be made by clicking the checkboxes of the MO(s) you want to return. You can select MO ranges by clicking the first item, then hold shift and click the last.
The rows clicked and all rows in between are selected. You can select all the MOs in the table by clicking the checkbox in the table header.

step.cmd: Add the MO(s) to a Collection

ol.li: Click the Add to a Collection button in the Action Bar. A Flyout Panel is displayed. The MO(s) can be added to a new or existing Collection
To add the MO(s) to a new Collection, click the Add to a new Collection radio button

Enter a Collection name. This field is mandatory. You cannot use the name of a Collection or Managed Object type that already exists. You can only use alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z and 0-9), spaces and certain special characters. The supported special characters are:
. - _
Click the private or public sharing permissions radio button. The default value is private.
To add the MO(s) to an existing Collection, click the Add to an existing Collection radio button. A list of Collections that you are allowed to modify is displayed.
Click the Replace current objects checkbox if you want to overwrite the contents of the existing Collection.

The list of existing Collections can be filtered by name, sharing permissions and favorite status. To filter by name, type the required Collection name in the filter box. To filter by permissions, select the All, Public, or Private buttons. Click the Favorites button to view favorites.
Click on a Collection name to select that Collection.
Click the Add button to save the Collection.

A saved notification is displayed and the Collection name is displayed in the Network Panel under the Collections Tab.
Note : Refresh Network Explorer for latest Information in Network Panel.
